lines.text: Pull yourself together, William! What's a confidence man without confidence?

[Being chased by a bear]
We're going up a tree, William!
Here he comes! We'll soon find out!

[after shimmying up the tree]
William, I think it's a cinnamon bear.
I don't care what flavor he is. He's more apt to taste me.
Once they make you walk up an alley, you never use a front door again.
An oil well is a hole in the ground surrounded by suckers.
It may interest to you to know, my good man, that I and the minutest coin of the realm are total strangers.
